issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

Titanium SDK version: 1.5.0 (11/29/10 08:10 faa27c7). G2 (2.2) some G1 (1.6) some droid 1 (2.2)

1.Phone > contacts > display people
2.select a contact that has an address associated with it.
3.read results

results: "No addresses to show"

missed on last weeks pass, occurs in 1.5.0.91838a as well. Functionality did not exist in 1.4.2, so no regression tag or priority set by me.

{html}
fields.summary: Android: Phone > contacts addresses are not being displayed (erroneous "no address found" alert)

comments.body:
{html}

It's a problem with how our KrollDict is converted and put into JS. I have a solution.

{html}

{html}

(from [ac7cfd81894306bfc1928f55d1a83902a492bf01]) [#2471 state:fixed-in-qa] give our special ScriptableMap class enough overrides of Rhino's ScriptableObject to succeed in iterating its properties (the map keys) and checking if a key exists so 'key' in object can be used in Javascript https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/commit/ac7cfd818943...

{html}

{html}

Titanium SDK version: 1.5.0 (12/01/10 09:30 ac7cfd8) Android device (1.6, 2.1) KS

{html}
